rComments: Denise is extremely passionate about what she teaches and uses class time efficiently. The readings are always interesting and the paper topics aren't too bad/too long (except the 10 page research paper but you choose the topic ). I really enjoyed her class. She provides clear grading criteria. Go to class and participate as that will help!

Prof.Silva is one of the best English teachers I have ever had. Its true that it is hard to get an A but if you go to her office hours and work hard, she will notice and she will give you your grade. Just participate in class, go to office hours and make sure to never miss a day of class cause she considers that when giving you your grade.
Nice and approachable. Does peer editing. Participation counts towards grade. Readings were not that interesting. Ok class. She is willing to help however she can.

Denise was great, and pretty easy to get through. A lot of reading from the course reader, some pieces are bland. The whole class has to participate in order for the class to be fun. She is great at editing papers and clear on what she is looking for on each paper. 5 papers: 1 persuasive, 1 research, 1 auto biography, 1 academic, and 1 creative.

Denise genuinely cares about her students. She is kind, straight-forward, and open to ideas. She is patient and offers fair critique. She was very knowledgeable of the subject and her interest was evident in her teaching. Very organized and clear. Very fun and interesting writing class.

Attempted to be engaging, but was often bland and uninteresting. While generally kind, she was also very passive aggressive in critiquing, which did not help my learning experience in the slightest. I could not wait to get out of that class.
Silva was a great writing teacher. Wrote good feedback for the student, and really tried to help the student improve their writing. It's pretty tough to get an A, but she gives a lot of B's.

She is pretty helpful, and class is relatively engaging. Easy B, harder A, but she gives you a lot of opportunities to raise your grade. Just turn in all assignments, and revise essays, and an A shouldn't be to hard. NOTE: she says she doesn't grade, but still gives checks with + or - on it, so...
she has a nice voice that is easy, but sometimes boring, to listen to.  she's an ample discusser of things.  kind of an unclear grader, but english can be like that sometimes i suppose.
She is pretty great, however becuase she doesn't give grades it seems a bit of a challenge to get an A.

She was very helpful in hear feedback on essays and in teaching effective essay writing strategies.  You turn in your essays at the end of the quarter, so if you are someone who prefers to do a lot of revisions then Silva is a good teacher for you.  Overall her class is very laid back and not too challenging.

She was a good teacher, but she treats her students like little kids, and it can get annoying at times.  She doesn't seem to be able to excite the class to actually have real discussions, and so it wasn't that fun of a class.  She could be a better teacher, but she could also be a lot worse.  If you're looking for an okay time, take her class.

She's really helpful and her vibrant personality really shines through in her teaching.  She's always anxious to hold office hours and go over material and essays with you. She gives back a full page of response to each essay also. SUPER GOOD TEACHER! (and good looking!)

She was a very helpful teacher. Her comments on the papers I wrote were extremely helpful in improving my writing. She doesn't force her opinions on you like other teachers, she helps start the discussions... Her class was my favorite of the quarter. She's realy good. I definetley recommend her.
